## Description {#details}

An array constant whose element type is a simple 1/2/4/8-byte integer or float/double, and whose elements are just simple data values (i.e.

ConstantInt/ConstantFP). This <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> node has no operands because it stores all of the elements of the constant as densely packed data, instead of as Value&#42;&#39;s.

Definition at line 696 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.

### getFP() {#a6eec77c77aa76611db6766a3f205570c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; ConstantDataArray::getFP (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; ElementType, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint16&#95;t &gt; Elts)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
<a href="#a6eec77c77aa76611db6766a3f205570c">getFP()</a> constructors - Return a constant of array type with a float element type taken from argument ‘ElementType`, and count taken from / argument ‘Elts`.

The amount of bits of the contained type must match the number of bits of the type contained in the passed in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>. (i.e. half or bfloat for 16bits, float for 32bits, double for 64bits) Note that this can return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantaggregatezero">ConstantAggregateZero</a> object.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00740">740</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l02970">2970</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getRaw() {#ad86e02b5bee8ad12233bbf1719d1312f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Constant &#42; llvm::ConstantDataArray::getRaw (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Data, uint64&#95;t NumElements, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; ElementTy)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
<a href="#ad86e02b5bee8ad12233bbf1719d1312f">getRaw()</a> constructor - Return a constant with array type with an element count and element type matching the NumElements and ElementTy parameters passed in.

Note that this can return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantaggregatezero">ConstantAggregateZero</a> object. ElementTy must be one of i8/i16/i32/i64/half/bfloat/float/double. Data is the buffer containing the elements. Be careful to make sure Data uses the right endianness, the buffer will be used as-is.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00728">728</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getString() {#a3edef3fa47c611d3d10606591213e57b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; ConstantDataArray::getString (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> &amp; Context, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Initializer, bool AddNull=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This method constructs a CDS and initializes it with a text string.

The default behavior (AddNull==true) causes a null terminator to be placed at the end of the array (increasing the length of the string by one more than the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> would normally indicate. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> AddNull=false to disable this behavior.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00749">749</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l02991">2991</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
